titlestmt.titleproper: Ezra Strong Letters To Solomon Strong 1862-1864

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

repository.corpname: Oregon Historical Society, Davies Family Research Library

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.unittitle: Ezra Strong letters to Solomon Strong
did.abstract: Letter from Ezra Strong to Solomon Strong, 27-31 October 1862, regarding the death of a great-grandson, a son's enlistment in the Union army, abolition, politics, murders by Sioux in Minnesota, and the fulfillment of Joseph Smith's prophecies and the impending apocalypse, with post script from Samson Strong urging Solomon to reexamine his political beliefs; Letter from Ezra Strong to Solomon Strong, 5-20 March 1864, regarding life in New Mexico, relations with Paiutes and Navajos, prices, hopes of prospecting in Idaho and the death of Samson Strong.

scopecontent.p: Letter from Ezra Strong to Solomon Strong, 27-31 October 1862, regarding the death of a great-grandson, a son's enlistment in the Union army, abolition, politics, murders by Sioux in Minnesota, and the fulfillment of Joseph Smith's prophecies and the impending apocalypse, with post script from Samson Strong urging Solomon to reexamine his political beliefs; Letter from Ezra Strong to Solomon Strong, 5-20 March 1864, regarding life in New Mexico, relations with Paiutes and Navajos, prices, hopes of prospecting in Idaho and the death of Samson Strong.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library prior to any use of reproductions. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use of reproductions may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright holders.

prefercite.p: Ezra Strong letters to Solomon Strong, Mss 1500, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.

controlaccess.subject: Frontier and pioneer life -- New Mexico.
